content.text: JavaScript Maps

The Map Object
A Map object holds key-value pairs where the keys can be any datatype.
A Map also remembers the original insertion order of the keys.
How to Create a Map
You can create a JavaScript Map by:

Passing an Array to new Map()
Create a Map and use Map.set()
The new Map() Method
You can create a Map by passing an Array to the new Map() constructor:
The set() Method
You can add elements to a Map with the set() method:
The set() method can also be used to change existing Map values:
The get() Method
The get() method gets the value of a key in a Map:
Maps are Objects
typeof returns object:
instanceof Map returns true:
JavaScript Objects vs Maps
Differences between JavaScript Objects and Maps:

data: Do not have a size property

Browser Support
Map is an ES6  feature.
ES6 is fully supported in all modern browsers since June 2017:

Chrome51
    Edge15
    Firefox54
    Safari10
    Opera38
